title: Broken Access Control
description: Restrictions on what authenticated users are allowed to do are often not properly enforced.

title: Cryptographic Failures
description: Failures related to cryptography (or lack thereof) which often leads to sensitive data exposure.

title: Injection
description: User-supplied data is not validated, filtered, or sanitized by the application.

title: Insecure Design
description: A broad category representing different weaknesses, expressed as 'missing or ineffective control design.'

title: Security Misconfiguration
description: Simple or default configurations that are insecure.

title: Vulnerable and Outdated Components
description: Using software that is unsupported or out of date.

title: Identification and Authentication Failures
description: Problems with confirmation of the user's identity, authentication, and session management.

title: Software and Data Integrity Failures
description: Code and infrastructure that does not protect against integrity violations.

title: Security Logging and Monitoring Failures
description: Insufficient logging and monitoring to detect or respond to security incidents.

title: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
description: The web application fetches a remote resource without validating the user-supplied URL.
